stories.text:
Like many other devs where I work, I am staying in my current job for 3 reasons: 1. RSUs 2. Inertia 3. Limited experience in the current in vogue tools/technologies

Reasons 1 and 2 are not good reasons to stay, but reasons 3 requires a bit more prep/work to rectify.

I would really appreciate any advice HN can provide about how I can use the next 4-5 months to upskill and get interview fit?
stories.title: Ask HN: How can leave my comfortable old job for a new one?

stories.text: What are your weird startup or technology ideas, things that would be cool but that wouldn't necessarily be profitable or possible to build or otherwise practical.
stories.title: Ask HN: Weird Technology or Startup Ideas?
Video appears to show UK F-35 fighter crash after take-off

stories.text:
I am obtaining my bachelor's degree in computer science (information security major) this year. I come from a mathematics olympiad/competitive programming background and I feel more comfortable in the theoretical world of mathematics and algorithms than in the world of industrial applications (I am more proficient in it, too).

Do you think it's a good idea to pivot at this point (perhaps pursue a Master's degree in mathematics)? Do you have any success/failure stories to share?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there anyone who transitioned from IT to mathematics?
